contentrichtext.text: '''Zlonice''' is a [[market town]] in [[Central Bohemian Region]], [[Czech Republic]]. It is located 6 km north of [[Slaný]] and has a population of 2,279 (2006). Several valuable works of [[Baroque architecture]] have been preserved in Zlonice, for example the [[Assumption of Mary|Assumption]] [[Church (building)|church]] (by [[František Maxmilián Kaňka|F.M. Kaňka]]) and the [[rectory]] (by [[Kilian Ignaz Dientzenhofer|K.I. Dientzenhofer]]). The former hospital building houses the Memorial of composer [[Antonín Dvořák]] who lived in Zlonice from 1853 to 1856; he nicknamed his [[Symphony No. 1 (Dvořák)|First Symphony]] ''The Bells of Zlonice''. There is also a small Railway Museum at the local [[train station]]. == External links == * {{cs icon}} [http://zlonice.cz Official website] * {{cs icon}} [http://zmzlonice.draha.net/ Railway Museum] * {{cs icon}} [http://skzlonice.wz.cz/ SK Zlonice - Football Club] {{coord|50|17|N|14|06|E|region:CZ_type:city|display=title}} {{Kladno District}} [[Category:Market towns in the Czech Republic]] [[Category:Kladno District]] {{Kladno-geo-stub}}
